instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Resets if you unplug charger or measure voltage on SMC Reset L
threads.message:
board had liquid damage along top edge effecting Sys one wire system. Replaced all bad components, replaced <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>, SMC, SMC Reset 100K <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR> Resistor, and pulled <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> to see if <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was resetting it somehow.

Im kind of lost, the voltage when I meter the line is 3.4-3.42v but it may be dipping when I first stick my probe to it. It seems this line is pulled up to 3.42 at the <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR> resistor but I have tested and replaced this and no change.
The computer will boot and charge fine. When you plug in the charger the light goes green to orange and charges but when you unplug the charger it will reset the system like you just pulled power and then reconnected it instantly. Kind of lost on how this is happening.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Resets if you unplug charger or measure voltage on SMC Reset L
threads.message:
It is normal that if you touch the reset line it will glitch so nothing to worry there. 

So the problem is that the machine shuts down if you unplug the charger? Does it run off the battery alone?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Resets if you unplug charger or measure voltage on SMC Reset L
threads.message: Yes it will run off battery alone and it will also run on charger only. If I plug in the charger while on battery only, it will start to charge the battery but if I unplug it the system will shut off and automatically reboot. Chimes again without pressing anything

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Resets if you unplug charger or measure voltage on SMC Reset L
threads.message: If I plug in the charger with battery connected it will go green to orange and does not auto boot unless directly after battery reconnect which seems normal. Power button functions properly on keyboard and it does this even when the keyboard is unplugged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Resets if you unplug charger or measure voltage on SMC Reset L
threads.message: Well now its not doing it. i put it back in the frame to test a few more things and its working now.. It wont reboot like it was doing when I unplug the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Resets if you unplug charger or measure voltage on SMC Reset L
threads.message: Hmm, I have no idea what is going on. If it seems working now give it a good burn in to see if issues return. Possibly the resistor and diode the feed 3V42 when on battery that are flaky? <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> <DIODE>D6990</DIODE>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Resets if you unplug charger or measure voltage on SMC Reset L
